Reviews.Title: “Pretty awful”
Reviews.Author: AndrewtLondon
Reviews.Content: IN poor repair: the light didnt work and the guy just shrugged. They couldnt find my Expedia reservation and couldnt tell me whether they had taken a deposit. Breakfast is poor. The location is very good on Reforma. It was fairly cheap at 485 but I would have preferred to pay a bit more. The manager is pretty grumpy too

Reviews.Title: “Best for quality/price”
Reviews.Author: traveller65432107
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, cheap prices (50$US a night) and you're 200 meters from reforma avenue. A short walk to the subway (1 kilometer).

Reviews.Title: “Practical if you're not too picky.”
Reviews.Author: travelr1961
Reviews.Content: The hotel Reforma Avenue is well located, just a couple of blocks from the subway. The Zocalo is nearby as well as Bellas Artes. The hotel is not fancy, but it will do. You have to ask for your towels (huh?). Breakfast is included. The room is reasonably clean. We felt very safe in this hotel, and that is worth a lot in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: veggiequeenja
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there twice, once alone and once with a friend. The location is perfect, it is near to the market at Balderas near to the large sat. art fair and near enough to the belles Artes and the Zocalo. It is always nice to start the day off with a good breakfast and you do get one there.Continental is free and for a few dollars you can get a full Mexican breakfast.Yum! Internet available downstairs for a fee, nice bar and some neat little restaurants nearby.There is a bank around the corner and the rooms are clean. I lie this place, not luxury but good enough for me.
